result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha M. LeMaster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs paid in full from cash bond.

Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 

If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Letter of apology to Medford Police officers due within 30 days, pre-approve by agent.

Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.

Defendant would be eligible to petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of probation.
Undergo AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Conditional jail term shall begin no later than Friday, May 23, 2014 at 4:30 pm.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

miscConds.notes: The costs have been paid from defendant's bond.

supervisions.notes: Court costs paid in full from cash bond.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

District Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samantha M. LeMaster appeared in court, in custody with Attorney Shawn Paul.  Attorney Tlusty indicated that the parties reached an agreement.  Agreement put into the record.  Court ordered 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision for a total of 3 years six months to run concurrent with the Marathon County Case 16CF134.  Court ordered court costs and restitution.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.    There is 347 days sentence credit.  Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samantha M. LeMaster in court with attorney Justin D Wolff.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record.  DE entered a plea of guilty to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to the agreement, tracking traffic cases 14TR36, 14TR37. and 14TR39 are dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes. Brief comments by counsel.  Court withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:  75 days county jail with Huber to start no later than 05-23-2014 at 4:30 pm; payment of court costs; provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge; AODA and follow through; letter of apology to Medford Police officers due witin 30 days, pre-approved by agent; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; 6 month DL revocation.  On Ct. 2 the court imposed payment of court costs.  Upon successful completion of probation, defendant would be eligible to petition for expungement.
Letter to Defendant
Days Credit Worksheet
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Samantha M. LeMaster in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Robert Stieber, sworn and testified.  State has shown probable cause a felony was committed in Taylor County and DE bound over for arraignment.  Information filed with further reading of same waived.  Plea of not guilty entered.  Matter to proceed to PTC set on 05-02-2014.
of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody, with Attorney Justin Wolf.  Court ordered Clerk of Court to begin bond revocation proceedings in this case for alleged bond violations.

Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Samantha M. LeMaster in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of complaint; requested a preliminary hearing with time limits waived.  PTC set for 03-19-2014 at 1:45 pm.  State recommended a $3,000 signature bond with booking and no operation of motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  No objection - so ordered.  Citations 14TR36-40 shall track.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
